snippet: The prosecution of Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair came apart Monday, and questions about the credibility of his accuser may have sowed doubts months earlier.
abstract: Collapse of sexual assault case against Brig Gen Jeffrey A Sinclair started when evidence emerged months earlier that cast doubt on credibility of his accuser; forensics disproved the accuser and sole witness's assertion about potential evidence on a cellphone; breakdown of prosecution's case represents a black eye for the Army at a time when it is trying to fend off criticism of endemic sexual assault.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Fort Bragg, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: The prosecution of Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair came apart Monday, and questions about the credibility of his accuser may have sowed doubts months earlier.

headline.main: How a Military Sexual Assault Case Foundered
headline.print_headline: How a Military Sexual Assault Case Foundered

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
